CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rendered a judgment in favour of the applicant and ordered the applicant ’s employer “ LOC ” AD ORG ( hereinafter “ the debtor ” ) to carry out a reallocation of plots for the construction of apartments . This judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested enforcement of the above judgment and the ORG issued an enforcement order on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Herceg Novi First Instance Court transferred the case to ORG for further action .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended ( obustavio ) the enforcement due to the opening of the insolvency proceedings , which decision became final on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The judgement in question remains unenforced to the present day .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted administrative proceedings seeking , on the basis of the above judgment , the removal of competing titles from ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG terminated ( prekinuo ) the administrative proceedings because ORG had commenced insolvency proceeding in respect of the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted an objection against the above decision . This objection was rejected as being out of time by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The administrative proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified day in DATE , the applicant instituted separate civil proceedings against the debtor , as his former employer , seeking reinstatement and damages . Following CARDINAL remittals , on DATE the ORG rendered a judgment in the applicant ’s favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment on the merits , but quashed it as regards the costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG transferred the case to ORG for further action due to the commencement of the insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled partly in favour of the applicant regarding the costs .
CARDINAL . The parties did not inform the ORG about when ORG decision became final and was served on the applicant .
